channel.title: Posts on HXL
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on HXL

item.title: Orange House Cat
item.author: j@hxl.io (Jordan Finnigan)
item.description: There’s a weird edge case to using Large Language Models (LLMs) trained by humans that I’ve seen come up in Google’s reCAPTCHA: Sometimes it identifies an object that resembles the one they think it is, but it’s not actually the one they think it is.

item.title: Coffee
item.author: j@hxl.io (Jordan Finnigan)
item.description: I really didn’t care for coffee until my 20s.

item.title: Committed
item.author: j@hxl.io (Jordan Finnigan)
item.description:
It’s not at all uncommon to open a code repo and find the following commit messages:

version bump
fixed a bug
this works now

These are fine commit messages, but only for one person and at one point in time: the committer and the 5-minute period following the creation of the commit.
